arts.ttl: Van Hecke own goal completes Tottenham fightback as Brighton blow two-goal lead
arts.athr: John Brewin at the Amex Stadium
arts.sum: Familiar failings from Tottenham, proof that a change of management can never immediately cure previous ills. There is, though, a fighting spirit within Thomas Frankâ€™s new Spurs, whereas last season in the Premier League, there was rarely much beyond surrender. Brighton scored two fine first-half goals, Yankuba Mintehâ€™s solo mission followed by an opportunistic long-range strike from Yasin Ayari, in a 45 minutes where Tottenham dominated possession but repeatedly left open the door. arts.sum: The second own goal for Tottenham in a week, but own goals come through pressure. After the game, Thomas Frank needs to explain why he dropped Zavi Simons, who was an immediate and positive influence, from his first touch.
